alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 15 at 9:35AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of East Central Maine, including the following county, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in Pushaw Road in Glenburn. Small stream flooding will continue due to 3 to 5 inches of rain fallen overnight into this morning. - Pushaw Road in Glenburn is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Orono, Hermon, Kenduskeag, Glenburn, Levant, Hudson and Alton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
